translated: Description of Persons
The Mātikā
The Single Section
Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.
There are six descriptions:

original: khandhapaññatti, āyatanapaññatti, dhātupaññatti, saccapaññatti, indriyapaññatti, puggalapaññattīti.
analyzed: khandha paññatti āyatana paññatti dhātu paññatti sacca paññatti indriya paññatti puggala paññatti iti
translated: the description of the categories, the description of the sense-spheres, the description of the elements, the description of the truths, the description of the faculties, the description of the persons.
In what sense is there a description of the categories as categories?
In so far as there are five categories:

analyzed: rūpa kkhandhaḥ vedanā kkhandhaḥ saññā kkhandhaḥ saṅkhāra kkhandhaḥ viññāṇa kkhandhaḥ
translated: the materiality category, the feeling category, the perception category, the determinations category, the consciousness category;
in this sense there is a description of the categories as categories.
In what sense is there a description of the sense-spheres as sense-spheres?
In so far as there are twelve sense-spheres:

original: cakkhāyatanaṁ, rūpāyatanaṁ, sotāyatanaṁ, saddāyatanaṁ, ghānāyatanaṁ, gandhāyatanaṁ, jivhāyatanaṁ, rasāyatanaṁ, kāyāyatanaṁ, phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ, manāyatanaṁ, dhammāyatanaṁ;
analyzed: cakkhāyatana rūpāyatana sotāyatana saddāyatana ghānāyatana gandhāyatana jivhāyatana rasāyatana kāyāyatana phoṭṭhabbāyatana manāyatana dhammāyatana
translated: the eye sense-sphere, the visible-form sense-sphere, the ear sense-sphere, the sound sense-sphere, the nose sense-sphere, the odour sense-sphere, the tongue sense-sphere, the flavour sense-sphere, the body sense-sphere, the tangible sense-sphere, the mind sense-sphere, the idea sense-sphere;
in this sense there is a description of the sense-spheres as sense-spheres.
In what sense is there a description of the elements as elements?
As far as there are eighteen elements:

original: cakkhudhātu, rūpadhātu, cakkhuviññāṇadhātu, sotadhātu, saddadhātu, sotaviññāṇadhātu,
analyzed: cakkhu dhātu rūpa dhātu cakkhu viññāṇa dhātu sota dhātu sadda dhātu sota viññāṇa dhātu
translated: The eye element, form element, eye-consciousness element, the ear element, sound element, ear-consciousness element,

original: ghānadhātu, gandhadhātu, ghānaviññāṇadhātu, jivhādhātu, rasadhātu, jivhāviññāṇadhātu,
analyzed: ghāna dhātu gandha dhātu ghāna viññāṇa dhātu jivhā dhātu rasa dhātu jivhā viññāṇa dhātu
translated: the nose element, smell element, nose-consciousness element, the tongue element, taste element, tongue-consciousness element,

original: kāyadhātu, phoṭṭhabbadhātu, kāyaviññāṇadhātu, manodhātu, dhammadhātu, manoviññāṇadhātu;
analyzed: kāya dhātu phoṭṭhabba dhātu kāya viññāṇa dhātu manaḥ dhātu dhammadhātu manas viññāṇa dhātu
translated: the body element, tangibles element, body-consciousness element, the mind element, mind-object element, mind-consciousness element;
this is the extent to which there is a designation of elements as elements.
As far as there is a designation of truths as truths?
As far as there are four truths:

analyzed: dukkha sacca samudaya sacca nirodha sacca magga sacca
translated: The truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, the truth of the path;
this is the extent to which there is a designation of truths as truths.
As far as there is a designation of faculties as faculties?
As far as there are twenty-two faculties:

original: cakkhundriyaṁ, sotindriyaṁ, ghānindriyaṁ, jivhindriyaṁ, kāyindriyaṁ, manindriyaṁ,
analyzed: cakkhundriya sotindriya ghānindriya jivhindriya kāyindriya manindriya
translated: The eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, the mind faculty,

original: itthindriyaṁ, purisindriyaṁ, jīvitindriyaṁ, sukhindriyaṁ, dukkhindriyaṁ, somanassindriyaṁ,🔽domanassindriyaṁ, upekkhindriyaṁ, saddhindriyaṁ, vīriyindriyaṁ, satindriyaṁ, samādhindriyaṁ,
analyzed: itthi indriya purisa indriya jīvita indriya sukha indriya dukkha indriya somanassa indriya  domanassa indriya upekkhā indriya vīriya indriya sati indriya samādhi indriya
translated: the femininity faculty, the masculinity faculty, the life faculty, the pleasure faculty, the pain faculty, the happiness faculty,🔽the grief faculty, the equanimity faculty, the faith faculty, the energy faculty, the mindfulness faculty, the concentration faculty,

analyzed: paññā indriya anaññātaññassāmi itindriya aññindriya aññātāvindriya
translated: the wisdom faculty, the I-shall-come-to-know-the-unknown faculty, the final-knowledge faculty, the final-knower faculty;
This is the way leading to the description of faculties.

analyzed: kittāvatā puggalānam puggala paññatti  samaya vimuttaḥ
translated: In what way is there a description of persons?🔽One freed in time
One not freed in time

analyzed: kuppa dhammaḥ  a kuppa dhammaḥ  parihāna dhammo
translated: One liable to fall away🔽One not liable to fall away🔽One liable to be inflamed
One not liable to be inflamed🔽One able to intend
One able to guard
An ordinary person
The lineage-holder🔽One restrained by fear
One not restrained by fear🔽One who has arrived at the possibility
One who has not arrived at the possibility🔽One who is definite
One who is indefinite🔽One who is practising for direct knowledge
One who is established in the fruit🔽One with a head like a lump of curd
One who is steady in the world🔽A noble one
A non-noble one
A trainee🔽A non-trainee
Neither a trainee nor a non-trainee
One with three knowledges
One with six deep knowledges
A Buddha with perfect deep knowledge
A Paccekabuddha
One freed in both ways
One liberated by wisdom
One who has attained to view

analyzed: saddhā vimuttaḥ  dhamma anusārī  saddhā anusārī
translated: One liberated by faith🔽One who follows the Dhamma🔽One who follows by faith

analyzed: satta kkhattu paramaḥ  kolaṅkolo  eka bījī  sakadāgāmī
translated: One who goes to the limit of the far shore🔽One who goes upstream to the Akaniṭṭha realm
One who goes upstream to the highest realm🔽One who goes upstream to the highest realm🔽One who goes upstream to the highest realm🔽One who attains nibbāna in the interval
One who attains nibbāna upon landing🔽One who attains nibbāna without exertion

One who attains nibbāna with exertion🔽One who goes upstream to the highest realm🔽One who attains nibbāna in the intermediate state🔽One who attains nibbāna upon landing🔽One who attains nibbāna without exertion

analyzed: uddha sotoaka niṭṭha gāmī  sa utāpannaḥ
translated: One who attains nibbāna with exertion🔽One who goes upstream to the highest realm🔽One who attains the fruit of stream-entry
One who is practicing to attain the fruit of stream-entry🔽One who attains the fruit of once-returning
One who is practicing to attain the fruit of once-returning🔽One who attains the fruit of non-returning
One who is practicing to attain the fruit of non-returning🔽One who attains the fruit of arahantship
One who is practicing to attain the fruit of arahantship
One by one.
